page.title: 18OUTDOOR ACTIVITES
page.content: Surprisingly large range of{leisure {activities}available. Most adults garden, and men fish. There is a {Frosterley Angling Club,}Permit Â£ 5; Licence Â£ 27. Largest fish caught was a 28lb salmon ,in 1984. Walking and riding are popular, and bowls, badmington and snooker are played in the{Village Hall.} Many go outside the village to ski, play squash, tennis, judo,karate,skating etc. A{recreation ground,}is found in the village, with swings, slide etc. and a large area of grass,for unorganised football and cricket. The low boundary wall on the main road is a{gathering spot}for the young, as are seats outside the Village Hall. A seat at the Butts is a meeting place for the elderly. Motor cycle trials ansd scrambles are held on the fell, and sledging is popular.
